target: Forty thousand brothers Couldn’t, even with all their quantity of love, Make up my sum.

orig: translate old to modern: Nay, he reserved a blanket, else we had been all shamed.
target: If he hadn’t, we’d all be embarrassed to look at him.

orig: translate old to modern: This man said, sir, that Don John, the Prince’s brother, was a villain.
target: This man said, sir, that Don John, the Prince’s brother, was a villain.

orig: translate old to modern: are we cuckolds, ere we have deserv'd it?
target: Are we betrayed before we have deserved it?

orig: translate old to modern: Thou art a strange fellow.
target: That’s an odd thing to say.

orig: translate old to modern: All that follow their noses are led by their eyes but blind men, and there’s not a nose among twenty but can smell him that’s stinking.
target: Everyone can see that, and even blind men can smell the stench of his misery now.

orig: translate old to modern: Some to Decius' house, and some to Casca's, some to Ligarius'.
target: Some go to Decius' house, and some to Casca's, some to Ligarius'.

orig: translate old to modern: What sum owes he the Jew?
target: How much does he owe the Jew?

orig: translate old to modern: The British powers are marching hitherward.
target: The British forces are on their way here.

orig: translate old to modern: Never to speak of this that you have heard: Swear by my sword.
target: Never to speak of what you have heard, Swear by my sword.

orig: translate old to modern: How all the other passions fleet to air, As, doubtful thoughts, and rash-embrac'd despair, And shudd'ring fear, and green-eyed jealousy.
target: How all the other passions fly to the air, As doubtful thoughts, and rash-embraced despair, And shuddering fear, and green-eyed jealousy!

orig: translate old to modern: You do advance your cunning more and more.
target: You move your cunning ahead more and more.

orig: translate old to modern: I will, my lord.
target: I will, my lord.

orig: translate old to modern: Give me audience, good madam.
target: Let me talk, good lady.

orig: translate old to modern: You stand amazed, But be of comfort.
target: Don’t worry about me.

orig: translate old to modern: The contents, as in part I understand them, are to blame.
target: The problem is in what the letter says, as far as I can tell.

orig: translate old to modern: To cut his throat i' the church.
target: To cut his throat in the church.

orig: translate old to modern: I fear me both are false.
target: I fear that your words and your heart are both false.

orig: translate old to modern: You have been hotly call'd for; When, being not at your lodging to be found, The Senate hath sent about three quests To search you out.
target: You have been hotly called for; When, you weren’t found at your lodging, The senate sent about three different requests To search for you.

orig: translate old to modern: Ay, madam, it is common.
target: Yes, madam, that’s the way it goes.

orig: translate old to modern: O, but she'll keep her word.
target: O, but she'll keep her word.

orig: translate old to modern: We’ll know all our fortunes.
target: We’ll all want our fortune told.

orig: translate old to modern: To feed my humor, wish thyself no harm.
target: If you want to make me happy, don’t wish yourself harm.

orig: translate old to modern: It is my arm.
target: Actually, it’s my arm.

orig: translate old to modern: Give me your answer, i' faith, do; and so clap hands and a bargain.
target: So give me your answer, and we’ll shake on it.

orig: translate old to modern: I pray you tell Benedick of it and hear what he will say.
target: Please, tell Benedick about her feelings and see what he has to say.

orig: translate old to modern: All may be well enough.
target: Everything may still be all right.

orig: translate old to modern: Ha?
target: Ha!

orig: translate old to modern: Which is the villain?
target: Which one of them did it?

orig: translate old to modern: His roguish madness Allows itself to any thing.
target: As a wandering lunatic, he can do whatever he wants.

orig: translate old to modern: Worthily spoken, Maecenas.
target: Well put, Maecenas.

orig: translate old to modern: Approach, Sir Andrew.
target: Come on, Sir Andrew.

orig: translate old to modern: Thy reason, man?
target: Why do you say that?

orig: translate old to modern: How, how, Cordelia?
target: What are you saying, Cordelia?

orig: translate old to modern: Thou hast a lady far more beautiful Than any woman in this waning age.
target: You have a noble wife who is much more beautiful than any other woman in this declining age.

orig: translate old to modern: Tis too bad, too bad.
target: Oh, it’s too terrible.

orig: translate old to modern: Make us thy ministers of chastisement, That we may praise thee in the victory!
target: Make us your agents of revenge, so we can praise you when we’re victorious!

orig: translate old to modern: If the tag-rag people did not clap him and hiss him according as he pleased and displeased them, as they use to do the players in the theatre, I am no true man.
target: If the common people didn’t applaud him and hiss at him, since he pleased and displeased them, as they used to do to the actors in the theatre, then I’m not really a man.

orig: translate old to modern: She Phoebes me.
target: She’s Phoebe-ing me.

orig: translate old to modern: In the most high and palmy state of Rome, A little ere the mightiest Julius fell, The graves stood tenantless, and the sheeted dead Did squeak and gibber in the Roman streets; As stars with trains of fire and dews of blood, Disasters in the sun; and the moist star, Upon whose influence Neptune's empire stands Was sick almost to doomsday with eclipse.
target: In the most high and palm tree-like state of Rome, A little before the mightiest Julius Caesar was killed, The graves had no bodies, and the dead in sheets Squeaked and gibbered in the Roman streets, And stars with trains of fire and red morning dews, Disasters in the sun.

orig: translate old to modern: Truly, sir, in respect of a fine workman, I am but, as you would say, a cobbler.
target: Truly, sir, in respect of a fine worker, I’m only, as you would say a cobbler.

orig: translate old to modern: I say it is the moon.
target: I say it’s the moon.

orig: translate old to modern: It may be so, my lord.
target: That may be true, my lord.

orig: translate old to modern: Who comes here?
target: Who’s coming here?

orig: translate old to modern: Now, princely Buckingham, seal thou this league With thy embracements to my wife’s allies And make me happy in your unity.
target: Now, noble Buckingham, seal this alliance by embracing my wife’s friends, and make me happy in your unity.

orig: translate old to modern: Oh, that I were a man for his sake!
target: Oh, if only I were a man!

orig: translate old to modern: Now, for I know the Breton Richmond aims At young Elizabeth, my brother’s daughter, And by that knot looks proudly on the crown, To her go I, a jolly thriving wooer.
target: Now I go, a jolly, thriving wooer, to marry my brother Edward’s young daughter, Elizabeth, because I know Richmond has his eye on her.

orig: translate old to modern: Methinks I do.
target: I think I do.

orig: translate old to modern: Will you hear the letter?
target: Do you want to hear what she says?

orig: translate old to modern: Come, there is sauce for it.
target: Come, here’s some sauce to go with it.

orig: translate old to modern: Masters, play here, I will content your pains; Something that's brief; and bid “Good morrow, general.” Why, masters, have your instruments been in Naples, that they speak i' the nose thus?
target: Gentlemen, play here, I will reward your pains, Something that's brief and say, “Good morning, General.” Hey, fellows, have your instruments been in Naples, that they sound as horrible as like this?

orig: translate old to modern: Why, so I can, sir, but I will not now.
target: Why, so I can, sir, but I won’t now.

orig: translate old to modern: Tempt not too much the hatred of my spirit; For I am sick when I do look on thee.
target: Don’t try my patience and push me too hard, Because the sight of you makes me sick.

orig: translate old to modern: I pray thee, cease thy counsel, Which falls into mine ears as profitless As water in a sieve.
target: Stop advising me; your words pass through my ears like water through a sieve.

orig: translate old to modern: No more, I pray thee; I am half afeard, Thou wilt say anon he is some kin to thee, Thou spend'st such high-day wit in praising him.
target: No more, please; I am half afraid You will now say he is related to you, You spend such so many words in praising him.

orig: translate old to modern: Is it come to this?
target: Has it come to this?

orig: translate old to modern: Good night, honest Iago.
target: Good night, honest Iago.

orig: translate old to modern: Come, Nerissa.
target: Come, Nerissa.

orig: translate old to modern: Am I yourself But, as it were, in sort or limitation, To keep with you at meals, comfort your bed, And talk to you sometimes?
target: Am I part of you But, as it were, in sort or limitation,— To keep you company at meals, sleep in your bed, And talk to you sometimes?

orig: translate old to modern: I’ll join with black despair against my soul And to myself become an enemy.
target: I plan to fall into the blackest despair.

orig: translate old to modern: Let me embrace with old Vincentio, And wander we to see thy honest son, Who will of thy arrival be full joyous.
target: Let me embrace the father of Lucentio, and then we’ll journey on to see your son, who will rejoice at your arrival.

orig: translate old to modern: And I trow this is his house.
target: And I think this is his house.

orig: translate old to modern: Being so frustrate, tell him, he mocks The pauses that he makes.
target: His position is hopeless.

orig: translate old to modern: Nor will do none tomorrow.
target: And he’s not going to do any tomorrow.

orig: translate old to modern: He hath no daughters, sir.
target: He doesn’t have any daughters, sir.

orig: translate old to modern: Marian, I say!
target: Maria!

orig: translate old to modern: Of Albany’s and Cornwall’s powers you heard not?
target: Have you heard about Albany’s and Cornwall’s troops?

orig: translate old to modern: Stay till I have read the letter.
target: Wait until I read the letter.

orig: translate old to modern: I was adored once too.
target: Someone adored me once, too.

orig: translate old to modern: Let us score their backs And snatch ’em up, as we take hares, behind!
target: Let’s slash their backs and grab ’em like we do rabbits, from behind.

orig: translate old to modern: So, Dolabella, It shall content me best.
target: So be it, Dolabella.

orig: translate old to modern: But, mistress, know yourself.
target: But mistress, know yourself.

orig: translate old to modern: There's warrant in that theft Which steals itself when there's no mercy left.
target: There’s protection in the theft That steals itself when there's no mercy left.

orig: translate old to modern: O knight, thou lackest a cup of canary.
target: Sir, you need a drink.

orig: translate old to modern: Did Cicero say anything?
target: Did Cicero say anything?

orig: translate old to modern: He’s a good fellow, I can tell you that.
target: He’s a good fellow, I can tell you that much.

orig: translate old to modern: That must we also.
target: That we must do that also.

orig: translate old to modern: Hark!
target: Listen!

orig: translate old to modern: Lucentio is your name.
target: Your name is Lucentio, you say.

orig: translate old to modern: What thou wouldst do Is done unto thy hand.
target: What you wanted is yours.

orig: translate old to modern: What, is Antonio here?
target: What, is Antonio here?

orig: translate old to modern: I am sure you know him well enough.
target: I’m sure you know him.

orig: translate old to modern: What says Lord Stanley?
target: What does Lord Stanley say?

orig: translate old to modern: Resolve yourselves apart: I'll come to you anon.
target: I'll come to you in a minute.

orig: translate old to modern: Must there no more be done?
target: Isn’t there more be done?

orig: translate old to modern: God send you joy, Petruchio.
target: God give you joy, Petruchio.

orig: translate old to modern: Dead.
target: Dead.

orig: translate old to modern: Crowns in my purse I have and goods at home, And so am come abroad to see the world.
target: I have money in my purse and property at home, so I’m off to see the world.

orig: translate old to modern: What, man!
target: What, man!

orig: translate old to modern: Oh, oh, oh!
target: Oh, oh, oh!

orig: translate old to modern: My husband?
target: My husband!

orig: translate old to modern: from whence ariseth this?
target: What started this?

orig: translate old to modern: Now the witch take me if I meant it thus!
target: May the evil one take me if I meant it like that!

orig: translate old to modern: I know when one is dead and when one lives.
target: I know how to tell when someone is alive or dead.

orig: translate old to modern: If she be black, and thereto have a wit, She'll find a white that shall her blackness fit.
target: If she is black and also has a wit, She'll find a white that will her blackness fit.

orig: translate old to modern: How goes it now?
target: How goes it now?

orig: translate old to modern: Well, fare you well, my lord.
target: Well then, good bye, my lord.

orig: translate old to modern: What, To kiss in private?
target: What, To kiss in private?

orig: translate old to modern: The foul’st best fits My latter part of life.
target: The foulest fate would be most appropriate for me now in this latest phase of my life.

orig: translate old to modern: Doth my simple feature content you?
target: Do my simple features please you?

orig: translate old to modern: The abuse of greatness is when it disjoins Remorse from power, and, to speak truth of Caesar, I have not known when his affections sway'd More than his reason.
target: The abuse of greatness is when it disconnects Remorse from power, and, to speak truth about Caesar, I haven’t known a time when his emotions were swayed More than his reason.

orig: translate old to modern: Look to the lady.
target: Look to the lady.

orig: translate old to modern: Lord, what fools these mortals be!
target: O, beware, my lord, of jealousy; Lord, what fools these mortals be!

orig: translate old to modern: If thou attempt it, it will cost thee dear: Thou hast no weapon, and perforce must suffer.
target: You have no weapon, and must be forced to suffer.

orig: translate old to modern: O, let the heavens Give him defense against the elements, For I have lost him on a dangerous sea.
target: O, let the heavens Give him defense against the elements, Because I have lost him on a dangerous sea!

orig: translate old to modern: What many men desire.—that many may be meant By the fool multitude, that choose by show, Not learning more than the fond eye doth teach; Which pries not to th' interior, but, like the martlet, Builds in the weather on the outward wall, Even in the force and road of casualty.
target: that “many” may mean The foolish multitudes, that choose by outward appearance, Not learning any more than their loving eyes teach, Which doesn’t go to the inside but, like the marten, Builds on the outside wall in any weather, Even in the force of wind and on the road to ruin.

orig: translate old to modern: to Adrian] Methinks our garments are now as fresh as [to Adrian] Methinks our garments are now as fresh as when we put them on first in Afric, at the marriage of the King's fair daughter Claribel to the King of Tunis.
target: I think our garments are now as fresh as they were when we first put them in Africa, at the wedding of the king's fair daughter, Claribel, to the King of Tunis.

orig: translate old to modern: But why, why, why?
target: But why, why, why?

orig: translate old to modern: O, a thousand, a thousand times.
target: O, a thousand, a thousand times.

orig: translate old to modern: Would I have never Married my daughter there!
target: I wish I had never Married my daughter there!

orig: translate old to modern: What is amiss?
target: What’s wrong?

orig: translate old to modern: Here comes one o' the parings.
target: Here comes the owner of one piece.

orig: translate old to modern: I have nothing to do with thee.
target: I’ve got nothing to do with you.

orig: translate old to modern: Sweet Portia, If you did know to whom I gave the ring, If you did know for whom I gave the ring, And would conceive for what I gave the ring, And how unwillingly I left the ring, When nought would be accepted but the ring, You would abate the strength of your displeasure.
target: Sweet Portia, If you knew to whom I gave the ring, If you knew for whom I gave the ring, And would think about for what I gave the ring, And how unwillingly I let the ring go, When nothing would be accepted but the ring, You would decrease the strength of your anger.

orig: translate old to modern: Arm you, I pray you, to this speedy voyage; For we will fetters put upon this fear, Which now goes too free-footed.
target: Get started, I beg you, on this speedy voyage, For we will control this fear, Which now goes about too freely.

orig: translate old to modern: Why, 'tis an office of discovery, love; And I should be obscur'd.
target: Why, light is a function of discovering things, love, And I should be hidden.

orig: translate old to modern: Hear the shrill whistle, which doth order give To sounds confused.
target: Hear the shrill whistle that brings order to the hubbub.

orig: translate old to modern: Tis exactly valued, Not petty things admitted.
target: Not even trivial things were left out.

orig: translate old to modern: I am glad that my weak words Have struck but thus much show of fire from Brutus.
target: I’m glad that my weak words Have brought out this show of fire from Brutus.

orig: translate old to modern: For love of God, forbear him!
target: For love of God, leave him alone!

orig: translate old to modern: I pray you, know me, when we meet again; I wish you well, and so I take my leave.
target: Please, recognize me when we meet again: I wish you well, and so I say goodbye.

orig: translate old to modern: aside] Praise in departing.
target: Praise in departing.

orig: translate old to modern: Give me your arm.
target: Give me your arm.

orig: translate old to modern: He cannot flatter, he.
target: No flattery for him, no sir!

orig: translate old to modern: Be thou my witness that, against my will, As Pompey was, am I compell'd to set Upon one battle all our liberties.
target: You be my witness that, against my will, As Pompey was, I am compelled to set All our liberties on one battle.

orig: translate old to modern: Not I, believe me.
target: Not me.

orig: translate old to modern: Heavens make our presence and our practices Pleasant and helpful to him!
target: May the heavens make our presence and our practices Pleasant and helpful to him!

orig: translate old to modern: My countrymen— Peace!
target: My countrymen,— Peace!

orig: translate old to modern: No, as I am a Christian.
target: No, as I am a Christian.

orig: translate old to modern: Faith, that was not so well; yet would I knew That stroke would prove the worst!
target: Faith, that was not good; still I wish I knew if That stroke would prove to be the worst!

orig: translate old to modern: I will employ thee back again; I find thee Most fit for business.
target: I’ll hire you again to go back to Rome.

orig: translate old to modern: Come, my young soldier, put up your iron.
target: Come on, put your sword away, my little soldier.

orig: translate old to modern: My necessaries are embark'd.
target: The things I need are all on the ship.

orig: translate old to modern: What!
target: What do you say?

orig: translate old to modern: Hence, get thee gone, and follow me no more.
target: Listen, get going and, once and for all, stop following me!

orig: translate old to modern: Things that are past are done, with me.
target: As far as I’m concerned, what’s past is done.

orig: translate old to modern: That sir which serves and seeks for gain,  And follows but for form,  Will pack when it begins to rain  And leave thee in the storm.
target: The gentleman who serves you only for profit And is only superficially loyal to you Will take off when it starts to rain And leave you alone in the storm.

orig: translate old to modern: Has here writ a letter to you.
target: He’s written you a letter.

orig: translate old to modern: Is there no respect of place, persons, nor time in you?
target: Don’t you have any respect for anything?

orig: translate old to modern: Nay, I am for all waters.
target: I can do anything!

orig: translate old to modern: Aside.
target: Aside.

orig: translate old to modern: O the blessed gods!
target: Oh, dear gods!

orig: translate old to modern: But forbear, I say.
target: But stop, I say.

orig: translate old to modern: He hath known you but three days, and already you are no stranger.
target: He’s only known you for three days, but he’s already treating you like a close friend.

orig: translate old to modern: Come, my spade!
target: Come, my spade.

orig: translate old to modern: Let's have no more of this; let's to our affairs.
target: Let's have no more of this; let's to our affairs.

orig: translate old to modern: What said he?
target: What did he say?

orig: translate old to modern: There thou mightst behold the great image of authority: a dog’s obeyed in office.
target: That’s authority!

orig: translate old to modern: And may not young men die as well as old?
target: Oh, and young men never die?

orig: translate old to modern: tell me that.
target: Tell me that.

orig: translate old to modern: The day will come that thou shalt wish for me To help thee curse that poisonous bunch-backed toad.
target: The day will come when you’ll wish I could help you cast spells against this poisonous, hunchbacked toad.

orig: translate old to modern: Where goes Cesario?
target: Where’s Cesario going?

orig: translate old to modern: May't please your Highness sit.
target: May it please your highness, sit.

orig: translate old to modern: Be't their comfort We are coming thither.
target: Let it be their comfort that We are coming there.

orig: translate old to modern: Why, I were best to cut my left hand off And swear I lost the ring defending it.
target: Why, it would be better if I cut my left hand off, And swear I lost the ring defending it.

orig: translate old to modern: Your answer to that.
target: Your answer to that.

orig: translate old to modern: I will plant you two, and let the fool make a third, where he shall find the letter.
target: I’ll have you two hide—and the fool too—right where he’ll find the letter.

orig: translate old to modern: When he is drunk asleep; or in his rage; Or in the incestuous pleasure of his bed; At game, a-swearing, or about some act That has no relish of salvation in't Then trip him, that his heels may kick at heaven, And that his soul may be as damn'd and black As hell, whereto it goes.
target: When he is asleep drunk, or in his rage, Or in the incestuous pleasure of his bed, At gaming, swearing, or committing some act That has no element of salvation in it, Then attack him, so that his heels may kick at heaven, And that his soul may be as damned and black As hell, where it goes to.

orig: translate old to modern: Make me not offended In your distrust.
target: Don’t insult me with your distrust.

orig: translate old to modern: And as I say, retire with me to my lodging, from whence I will fitly bring you to hear my lord speak.
target: In the meantime, come home with me, and when the time is right I’ll take you to talk to him.

orig: translate old to modern: My lady will hang thee for thy absence.
target: Lady Olivia will have you executed for not showing up.

orig: translate old to modern: Pray you do not, sir.
target: Please don’t, sir.

orig: translate old to modern: How?
target: How?

orig: translate old to modern: And what art thou that dar’st Appear thus to us?
target: Who do you think you are coming in here armed?

orig: translate old to modern: I kiss the instrument of their pleasures.
target: I kiss the instrument of their desires.

orig: translate old to modern: Art thou afeared?
target: Are you afraid?

orig: translate old to modern: They are, my lord.
target: They are, my lord.

orig: translate old to modern: In such a night, Did Jessica steal from the wealthy Jew, And with an unthrift love did run from Venice, As far as Belmont.
target: In such a night Jessica stole away from the wealthy Jew, And ran from Venice with a poor love As far as Belmont.

orig: translate old to modern: With Cassio, mistress.
target: With Cassio, mistress.

orig: translate old to modern: Speak to him.
target: Talk to him.

orig: translate old to modern: I am not well in health, and that is all.
target: I’m not feeling well, and that’s all.

orig: translate old to modern: to Adrian] But the rarity of it is, which is indeed [to Adrian] But the rarity of it is, which is indeed almost beyond credit— [to Antonio] As many vouched rarities are.
target: But the special thing about it is,—which is indeed almost beyond belief,— As many verified “special things” are.

orig: translate old to modern: Then be thou jocund.
target: Then, you be happy.

orig: translate old to modern: Peace, peace, Iras.
target: Quiet, quiet, Iras.

orig: translate old to modern: I shall not sleep in quiet at the Tower.
target: I can’t sleep quietly in the Tower.

orig: translate old to modern: He raised the house with loud and coward cries.
target: He woke up the whole house with his loud and cowardly screams.

orig: translate old to modern: I say I love thee more than he can do.
target: I say I love you more than he does.

orig: translate old to modern: Is in his retirement, marvellous distempered.
target: He’s, in his retirement to bed, exceedingly upset.

orig: translate old to modern: Tis a match.
target: Call it a match!

orig: translate old to modern: The wren goes to ’t, and the small gilded fly does lecher in my sight.
target: Little birds do it, and dragonflies copulate right in front of me.

orig: translate old to modern: Well demanded, wench; My tale provokes that question.
target: Good question, girl: My tale invites that question.

orig: translate old to modern: Most noble sir, arise.
target: Most noble sir, stand up.

orig: translate old to modern: Make me to see't; or at the least so prove it, That the probation bear no hinge nor loop To hang a doubt on; or woe upon thy life!
target: Make me see it ; or at the least prove it so That the accusation has no hinges or loops To hang a doubt on, or woe on your life!

orig: translate old to modern: This speed of Caesar’s Carries beyond belief.
target: Caesar’s speed defies belief.

orig: translate old to modern: This was looked for at your hand, and this was balked.
target: That’s what she was expecting, and you let her down.

orig: translate old to modern: I do entreat you, not a man depart, Save I alone, till Antony have spoke.
target: Please, no man leave, Except I alone, until Antony has spoken.

orig: translate old to modern: Ay.—Fare you well, fair gentleman.
target: Good luck, fair gentleman.

orig: translate old to modern: Not when I saw't.
target: Not when I saw it.

orig: translate old to modern: Your daughter here the princes left for dead.
target: The princes left your daughter here for dead.

orig: translate old to modern: Hang not on my garments.
target: Don’t hang on my clothes.

orig: translate old to modern: My lord!
target: my lord!

orig: translate old to modern: Hum, I have heard That guilty creatures, sitting at a play, Have by the very cunning of the scene Been struck so to the soul that presently They have proclaim'd their malefactions; For murder, though it have no tongue, will speak With most miraculous organ, I'll have these players Play something like the murder of my father Before mine uncle.
target: I have Heard that guilty creatures, sitting at a play, Have been so struck to the soul By the very cunning of the scene that presently They have confessed their evil deeds, Because murder, although it is silent, will speak With its own most miraculous organ, I’ll have these Players play something like the murder of my father Before my uncle.

orig: translate old to modern: Perchance, Iago, I will ne'er go home.
target: Maybe, Iago, I will never go home.

orig: translate old to modern: Good countrymen, let me depart alone, And, for my sake, stay here with Antony.
target: Good countrymen, let me leave alone, And, for my sake, stay here with Antony.

orig: translate old to modern: Because they are not eight?
target: Because it doesn’t have eight?

orig: translate old to modern: Come, mistress, you must tell's another tale.
target: Come, mistress, you must tell us another tale.

orig: translate old to modern: God, the best maker of all marriages, Combine your hearts in one, your realms in one.
target: May God, who is the best matchmaker, join your hearts and realms in one.

orig: translate old to modern: What says that fool of Hagar's offspring; ha?
target: What says that fool of Hagar's offspring, huh?

orig: translate old to modern: For I am he am born to tame you, Kate, And bring you from a wild Kate to a Kate Conformable as other household Kates.
target: I’m the man who was born to tame you and change you from a wildcat Kate into a Kate as gentle and domestic as other household Kates.

orig: translate old to modern: Comes the King forth, I pray you?
target: Is the king coming, I beg you?

orig: translate old to modern: But did you not request to have it cut?
target: But didn’t you expect us to cut the cloth?

orig: translate old to modern: Pay him six thousand, and deface the bond; Double six thousand, and then treble that, Before a friend of this description Shall lose a hair through Bassanio's fault.
target: Pay him six thousand, and destroy the promise to pay; Double six thousand, and then treble that, Before a friend of this description Loses a hair because of Bassanio.

orig: translate old to modern: Be patient.
target: Stay calm.

orig: translate old to modern: Come on.
target: Come on.

orig: translate old to modern: Worthy Cawdor!
target: Worthy Cawdor!

orig: translate old to modern: Do me no foul play, friends.
target: Don’t play any nasty tricks on me.

orig: translate old to modern: By sea, what else?
target: What else?

orig: translate old to modern: No farther than the Tower, and, as I guess, Upon the like devotion as yourselves, To gratulate the gentle princes there.
target: Just to the Tower—I’m guessing, for the same reason you are: to salute the noble princes who are staying there.

orig: translate old to modern: O noble Caesar!
target: O noble Caesar!

orig: translate old to modern: Your grandfather of famous memory, an’t please your Majesty, and your great-uncle Edward the Plack Prince of Wales, as I have read in the chronicles, fought a most prave pattle here in France.
target: If I may say so, your Majesty, your famous grandfather and your great-uncle Edward, the Black Prince of Wales—or so I’ve read in the history books—fought a very brave battle here in France.

orig: translate old to modern: Give you good night.
target: Have a good night.

orig: translate old to modern: My lord, you must tell us where the body is and go with us to the King.
target: My lord, you must tell us where the body is and go with us to the king.

orig: translate old to modern: And why, sir, must they so?
target: Why, sir, must he?

orig: translate old to modern: But for a fine, quaint, graceful, and excellent fashion, yours is worth ten on ’t.
target: But for a fine, elegant, graceful, and excellent dress, yours is worth ten of those.

orig: translate old to modern: Why, you were with him, were you not?
target: Why, you were with him, weren’t you?

orig: translate old to modern: I must to England; you know that?
target: I must go to England, you know that?

orig: translate old to modern: Tarry, good Beatrice.
target: Wait, good Beatrice.

orig: translate old to modern: Be brief, lest that the process of thy kindness Last longer telling than thy kindness' date.
target: Well, explain—but do it fast so that your puny store of kindness isn’t used up by talking about it.

orig: translate old to modern: Well, to our work alive.
target: Well, let’s get to our work.

orig: translate old to modern: You sulfurous and thought-executing fires, Vaunt-couriers of oak-cleaving thunderbolts, Singe my white head!
target: Let quick sulfurous lightning, strong enough to split enormous trees, singe the white hair on my head.

orig: translate old to modern: Am I a married man or a bachelor?
target: Am I a married man or a bachelor?

orig: translate old to modern: How many gentlemen have you lost in this action?
target: How many noblemen were killed in the battle you just fought?

orig: translate old to modern: to Stephano and Trinculo] Hence, and bestow your lug- [to Stephano and Trinculo] Hence, and bestow your lug- gage where you found it.
target: Here, and your baggage back where you found it.

orig: translate old to modern: But how is it That this lives in thy mind?
target: But how is it That this memory lives in your mind?

orig: translate old to modern: Why, then, 'tis hers, my lord, and being hers, She may, I think, bestow't on any man.
target: Why, then, it is hers, my lord, and being hers, She may, I think, give it to any man.

orig: translate old to modern: In religion, What damned error, but some sober brow Will bless it, and approve it with a text, Hiding the grossness with fair ornament?
target: In religion, What damned error is there that some sober face Will bless it, and approve it with a text, Hiding the grossness with a beautiful ornament?

orig: translate old to modern: But while I say one prayer!
target: But while I say one prayer!

orig: translate old to modern: Caesar, I shall.
target: Right away, Caesar.

orig: translate old to modern: It struck mine ear most terribly.
target: It was most terrible to hear.

orig: translate old to modern: When?
target: When?

orig: translate old to modern: His speech was like a tangled chain; nothing impaired, but all disordered.
target: His speech was like a tangled chain; nothing impaired, but all disordered.

orig: translate old to modern: Come, go with me apart; I will withdraw, To furnish me with some swift means of death For the fair devil.
target: Come, go aside with me; I will leave so I can Equip me with some swift means of death For the beautiful devil.

orig: translate old to modern: But since, so jump upon this bloody question, You from the Polack wars, and you from England, Are here arrived, give order that these bodies High on a stage be placed to the view; And let me speak to the yet unknowing world How these things came about.
target: But since, you from the Polack wars, and you from England, are here arrived, and so jump on this bloody Question, give order that these bodies High on a stage be placed to the view, And let me speak to the yet unknowing world How these things came about.

orig: translate old to modern: I take some joy to say you are because I would be talking of her.
target: I like to pretend you are, because then it’s almost like actually talking to her.

orig: translate old to modern: I heard him say, Brutus and Cassius Are rid like madmen through the gates of Rome.
target: I heard them say Brutus and Cassius Are riding like madmen through the gates of Rome.

orig: translate old to modern: I know him not.
target: I don’t know him.

orig: translate old to modern: Concerning this, sir—O well-painted passion!— I am commanded home.
target: I am commanded home.

orig: translate old to modern: Sister, it is not a little I have to say of what most nearly appertains to us both.
target: Sister, I have a lot to say about things that concern us both.

orig: translate old to modern: For Hecuba!
target: For Hecuba?

orig: translate old to modern: Here comes the good Macduff.
target: Here comes the good Macduff.

orig: translate old to modern: The oats have eaten the horses.
target: They’ve eaten themselves sick.

orig: translate old to modern: Nay, but hear me: Pardon this fault, and by my soul I swear, I never more will break an oath with thee.
target: No, but listen to me: Pardon this fault, and, by my soul, I swear I will never again break an oath made to you.

orig: translate old to modern: I'll be with you straight.
target: I’ll be with you right away.

orig: translate old to modern: Clubs cannot part them.
target: You couldn’t beat the two of them apart.

orig: translate old to modern: Is it upon record, or else reported Successively from age to age, he built it?
target: Is it on record that he built it, or is it just word of mouth?

orig: translate old to modern: Peace, you dull fool.
target: Quiet, you stupid fool.

orig: translate old to modern: Do you find some occasion to anger Cassio, either by speaking too loud, or tainting his discipline, or from what other course you please, which the time shall more favorably minister.
target: Find some occasion to make Cassio angry, either by speaking too loud, or insulting his discipline, or from whatever reason you please, which might be suggested by what’s happening at the time.

orig: translate old to modern: A ripe age.
target: A mature age.

orig: translate old to modern: Ay, and briefly.
target: Yes, and briefly.

orig: translate old to modern: How am I then a villain To counsel Cassio to this parallel course, Directly to his good?
target: How am I, then, a villain To advise Cassio to this parallel course, Directly to his good?

orig: translate old to modern: Freedom high-day!
target: Freedom, high day!

orig: translate old to modern: Oh, he hath murdered his master!
target: Oh God, he’s murdered his master!

orig: translate old to modern: Why came I hither but to that intent?
target: Why did I come here if not for that?

orig: translate old to modern: What, has his daughters brought him to this pass?— Couldst thou save nothing?
target: Have his daughters made him crazy like this?—Couldn’t you have kept something for yourself?

orig: translate old to modern: Think upon what hath chanced, and at more time, The interim having weigh'd it, let us speak Our free hearts each to other.
target: Let’s think about what has happened; and, later, When we’ve had a chance to think, let’s about these things openly each to other.

orig: translate old to modern: Why, what art thou?
target: Why, what are you?

orig: translate old to modern: O Lord, he will hang upon him like a disease!
target: Oh God, Benedick will plague him like a disease!

orig: translate old to modern: Yea, from the table of my memory I'll wipe away all trivial fond records, All saws of books, all forms, all pressures past, That youth and observation copied there; And thy commandment all alone shall live Within the book and volume of my brain, Unmix'd with baser matter.
target: Yes, from the table of my memory I’ll wipe away all unimportant records, All kinds of books, all pictures, all pressures past, That my youth and observations wrote there, And your commandment all by itself shall live Within the book and volume of my brain, Unmixed with other low thoughts.

orig: translate old to modern: To what end, my lord?
target: What for, my lord?

orig: translate old to modern: How sometimes his replies are!
target: How full of meaning his replies sometimes are!

orig: translate old to modern: Ay, my lord.
target: Yes, my lord.

orig: translate old to modern: The gates of mercy shall be all shut up, And the fleshed soldier, rough and hard of heart, In liberty of bloody hand, shall range With conscience wide as hell, mowing like grass Your fresh fair virgins and your flow'ring infants.
target: The gates of mercy will be closed by then, and harsh and hard-hearted soldiers, who have tasted blood, will have free reign to commit whatever violence they want, mowing down your lovely young virgins and budding infants.

orig: translate old to modern: What canst thou swear by now?
target: What can you swear by now?

orig: translate old to modern: Madam, I'll take my leave.
target: Madam, I'll leave.

orig: translate old to modern: Go with me and see What I can show in this.
target: Come and see the proof.

orig: translate old to modern: Then shall we be news-crammed.
target: Then we’ll be stuffed with news.

orig: translate old to modern: Leave, gentle wax, and, manners, blame us not.
target: Come on, envelope, open up for me.

orig: translate old to modern: Prithee, nuncle, be contented.
target: Please calm down, uncle.

orig: translate old to modern: If this uncouth forest yield anything savage, I will either be food for it or bring it for food to thee.
target: If I can find any animal in this wild forest, I’ll either be food for it or bring it as food for you.

orig: translate old to modern: Here comes the noble Antony.
target: Here comes the noble Antony.

orig: translate old to modern: Alas, how shall this bloody deed be answer'd?
target: Alas, how shall this bloody deed be explained?

orig: translate old to modern: If thou account’st it shame, lay it on me, And therefore frolic!
target: If you regard it as shameful, put the shame on me.

orig: translate old to modern: This my mean task Would be as heavy to me as odious, but The mistress which I serve quickens what's dead And makes my labours pleasures.
target: This mean task of mine Would be as heavy to me as hateful, except that The mistress I serve makes alive what's dead, And makes my labors pleasurable: Oh!

orig: translate old to modern: Nay, then you lie.
target: Well, you’re a liar, then.

orig: translate old to modern: Good morrow, Catesby.
target: Good day, Catesby.

orig: translate old to modern: What, will these hands ne'er be clean?
target: What, will these hands never be clean?

orig: translate old to modern: What, Gertrude?
target: What, Gertrude?

orig: translate old to modern: One woe doth tread upon another's heel, So fast they follow.
target: One sorrow walks on the heels of another, Following too fast.

orig: translate old to modern: Why, she comes to borrow nothing of them.
target: She’s not going to borrow money from them.

orig: translate old to modern: I will read it.
target: I will read it.

orig: translate old to modern: That may be, for you bear a many superfluously, and ’twere more honor some were away.
target: No doubt, for you wear too many in the first place, and it might be more seemly to make do with fewer.

target: And those who leave their valiant bones in France, dying like men though buried in your dunghills—they’ll be remembered, too.

target: In one voyage, Claribel found her husband at Tunis, And Ferdinand, her brother, found a wife Where he himself was lost; Prospero found his dukedom In a poor island; and all of us found ourselves, When no man was in his right minds.

target: Ha, ha, ha!

target: When Duncan is asleep, Which should be soon since he is very tired From his day's hard journey, I will go to his two chamberlains With wine and carousing so Their memory, the guardian of the brain, Will be a wisp of smoke, and the tired brain won’t Be able to think clearly.

target: What would you do To show yourself your father's son in deed More than in words?

target: Pretty, Cupid-like boys stood on either side of her, smiling and cooling her with multicolored fans, which seemed to fan the flames in her cheeks even as they cooled them, undoing what they did.

target: For my part, I have walked about the streets, Giving in to the dangerous night; And, undressed like this, Casca, as you can see, I have bared my chest to the thunder bolts; And when the angry, blue lightning seemed to openThe chest of heaven, I put myself Even in the direction and the very flash of it.

target: What’s your name, friend?

target: My father can’t think straight—a hundred knights!

target: And let me the small drink clink, clink; And let me the small drink clink.

target: Then it’s no surprise they had a bad influence on him.

target: This is the very product of your brain.

target: Oh wall, you have heard my moans very often, For separating my fair Pyramus and me.

orig: translate old to modern: It is myself I mean, in whom I know All the particulars of vice so grafted That, when they shall be open'd, black Macbeth Will seem as pure as snow, and the poor state Esteem him as a lamb, being compared With my confineless harms.
target: It is myself, I mean, in whom I know All the particulars of vice are so grafted That, when they shall be opened, black Macbeth Will seem as pure as snow, and the poor state Will respect him as a lamb, being compared With my unlimited evils.

target: Why are you calling him a jerk?

target: Then hear me, gracious sovereign, and all you peers who owe your lives and duty to this imperial throne.

target: Yours, Claudio, yours, I say.

orig: translate old to modern: that; And then, I grant, we put a sting in him That at his will he may do danger with.
target: And then, I admit, he may do danger, at his will, with A sting that we put in him.

target: And hell chew on his bones!

orig: translate old to modern: Out, strumpet!
target: Out, prostitute!

orig: translate old to modern: By this scimitar,— That slew the Sophy, and a Persian prince, That won three fields of Sultan Solyman,— I would o'erstare the sternest eyes that look, Outbrave the heart most daring on the earth, Pluck the young sucking cubs from the she-bear, Yea, mock the lion when he roars for prey, To win thee, lady.
target: By this sword,— That killed the Shah, a Persian prince, That won three battles with Sultan Solomon,— I would out stare the angriest eyes that look, Outbrave the most daring heart on the earth, Pluck the young, sucking cubs from their mother, Yes, taunt the lion when he roars for prey, To win you, lady.

target: Yes.

target: Toad, that has spent Thirty one days and nights under cold stone, From whose sweat a sleeping venom was gotten, Boil you first in the charmed pot!

target: Do we know this face or not?

target: In ten days time, if you’re found within twenty miles of the court, you’ll die for it.

target: When I burned in desire to question them further, they made themselves vanish into thin air.

target: I’m sorry my noble brother is suspicious of me.

target: The fool has planted in his memory An army of good words; and I know Many fools that stand in a better place, Dressed like him, except that a tricky word Defies definition.

orig: translate old to modern: He, being remiss, Most generous and free from all contriving, Will not peruse the foils; so that with ease, Or with a little shuffling, you may choose A sword unbated, and in a pass of practice, Requite him for your father.
target: He, being weak, Most generous, and free from all trickery, Will not think about swords, so that easily, Or with a little mix up, you may choose A sword that’s not poisoned, and, in a pass during Practice, kill him in revenge for your father.

target: They shouted three times.

target: You are gentlemen of brave spirit: you would lift the moon out of her orbit if she would continue in it for five weeks without changing.

orig: translate old to modern: It is Othello's pleasure, our noble and valiant general, that upon certain tidings now arrived, importing the mere perdition of the Turkish fleet, every man put himself into triumph; some to dance, some to make bonfires, each man to what sport and revels his addiction leads him; for besides these beneficial news, it is the celebration of his nuptial.
target: It is Othello's pleasure, our noble and valiant general, that on certain news now arrived, concerning the mere total destruction of the Turkish fleet, every man rejoice, some to dance, some to make bonfires, each man to whatever sport and revels his disposition leads him, because, besides this good news, it is the celebration of his wedding.

orig: translate old to modern: They met me in the day of success, and I have learned by the perfectest report, they have more in them than mortal knowledge.
target: They met me on the day we won the battle, and I have learned by the most perfect report that they have more in them than mortal knowledge.

target: Put money in your purse; follow the wars; defeat your mood with an false beard; I say, put money in your purse.

target: No, when light-winged toys Of feathered Cupid blind my knowing and Usual instruments of sight with unruly dullness, That if my games corrupt and stain my work, Let housewives make a skillet of my helmet, And all indignities and base adversities Make a boil of my reputation!

target: March to the bridge.

target: Still, I beg you, If you think it’s okay, or that it may be done, Get me a chance to speak briefly With Desdemona alone.

target: Alas, my friend and my dear countryman Roderigo?

target: we'll hear a play tomorrow.

target: Is that my prize?

target: The news accuses the speaker; Each minute turns up a new one.

target: What are you doing?

orig: translate old to modern: The deep of night is crept upon our talk, And nature must obey necessity, Which we will niggard with a little rest.
target: The deep of night has crept over our talk, And nature must obey necessity; Which we will put off with a little rest.

target: I’ll take a look at your letter.

target: What man is there so very unreasonable, That, if you had bothered to defend it With any terms of earnestness, lacked the modesty To encourage the thing be held as a ceremony?

orig: translate old to modern: Would I were assured Of my condition.
target: I wish I knew what is happening.

target: Say, what’s the trouble?

orig: translate old to modern: Come hither, come!
target: Come here.

orig: translate old to modern: In what particular thought to work I know not; But, in the gross and scope of my opinion, This bodes some strange eruption to our state.
target: I don’t know what its intentions are, But, in the plainness and freedom of my opinion, This foretells some strange eruption to our state.

orig: translate old to modern: My worthy lord, Your noble friends do lack you.
target: My worthy lord, Your noble friends are missing you.

orig: translate old to modern: Whether he was combined With those of Norway, or did line the rebel With hidden help and vantage, or that with both He labor'd in his country's wreck, I know not; But treasons capital, confess'd and proved, Have overthrown him.
target: I don’t know whether he combined Forces with those of Norway, or aided the rebel With hidden help and supplies, or that with both He labored to overthrow his country's government, Only his treasons, punishable by death, confessed and proven, have caused his downfall.

orig: translate old to modern: Yet again your fingers to your lips?
target: Still your fingers to your lips again?

orig: translate old to modern: What call you the carriages?
target: What do you call the carriages?

orig: translate old to modern: Had we done so at first, we had droven them home With clouts about their heads.
target: If we’d fought like this before, we’d have driven them home with bandaged heads.

orig: translate old to modern: By my hand I swear, and my father’s soul, the work ish ill done.
target: I swear by this hand and my father’s soul, the whole thing is a disaster.

orig: translate old to modern: Foul deeds will rise, Though all the earth o'erwhelm them, to men's eyes.
target: Wicked deeds will rise to be Seen even if they are buried very deep in the earth.

target: Come, let’s go to the king.

orig: translate old to modern: Do not so.
target: Don’t.

target: Give me your hand; Take me to my host.

orig: translate old to modern: I thank you most for him.
target: I thank you very much on his behalf.

target: This is not an act of man, nor any sound Like those on earth:—I hear it now above me.

target: Who's there?

target: Will you hear some music, my sweet love?

target: He shall not live; look, I condemn him with a check.

orig: translate old to modern: An oath of mickle might, and fury shall abate.
target: That’s an oath of great power, and our fury must subside.

orig: translate old to modern: Not altogether so, sir.
target: It’s not quite that simple.

orig: translate old to modern: Thy asses are gone about 'em.
target: Your attendant asses are getting the horses ready.

orig: translate old to modern: How low am I, thou painted maypole?
target: How low am I, you painted maypole?

orig: translate old to modern: Good my lord, enter here.
target: My lord, here is the entrance.

orig: translate old to modern: Nor no one here, for curses never pass The lips of those that breathe them in the air.
target: No one here is affected by your curse, because curses are just words with no power.

orig: translate old to modern: How came he mad?
target: How did he become crazy?

orig: translate old to modern: Tis as arrant a piece of knavery, mark you now, as can be offert, in your conscience now, is it not?

orig: translate old to modern: Read the will; we'll hear it, Antony.

target: That's my noble master!
